plugins.name: Multi-Link Copy
plugins.description:
Multi-Link Copy


Multi-Link Copy is designed to streamline the process of copying multiple frame or component links at once. If you're working on a large-scale design project, you may need to share or document the locations of multiple frames or components within a your file.


Instead of manually copying each link one by one, this plugin allows you to select multiple components or frames and generate their links in bulk. The links are copied to your clipboard in separate lines, making it easy to paste them into a spreadsheet, text file, or any document where you need to store or share those links.


What the Plugin Does:


Batch Copying of Links:

  1. The plugin generates URLs for selected components or frames within the current Figma file.
  2. Each link is a direct reference to the specific node (frame or component) inside the Figma file.
  3. These links are copied to your clipboard and can be pasted into any document, where each URL will appear on its own line in the order of your layer hierarchy in your Figma file (top layers first).


Use Case:

  1. When you need to share links to multiple frames or components in one go, especially for documentation, design reviews, developer hand-offs, or tracking design updates.
  2. Useful for project managers, designers, and developers who need quick access to the location of specific elements within a Figma file.


---


How to Use the Plugin:


1. Enter Figma File URL

  1. After launching the plugin, you will be prompted to enter the URL of your Figma file.
  2. This is required to extract the file key that’s necessary for generating URLs for the selected frames or components.
  3. This data is used temporarily by the plugin and never saved, read, or accessed by anyone.
  4. To get the URL, open the Figma file in your browser and copy the link from the address bar. It should look something like: https://www.figma.com/file/{fileKey}/Your-File-Name.


2. Selecting Elements

  1. Select the components, frames, or any other nodes you want to generate links for.


3. Copy Links

  1. Click "Copy Links" and a notification will appear confirming how many links were copied.
  2. The links are already copied to your clipboard, formatted one per line.


4. Paste Links

  1. Go to any document where you want to paste the links (e.g., Excel, Google Sheets, Notion, Slack, etc.).
  2. Each link will populate a new line or row in the document in the order of your layers in Figma (top layers first).


5. Celebrate 🎉


---


What You Can Expect:


Fast Bulk Link Generation: Select as many frames or components as needed, and the plugin will generate URLs for all selected items instantly.


Easy Copy and Paste: Once the plugin runs, the links are automatically copied to the clipboard. You don’t need to open a separate window or click additional buttons. Simply paste the links wherever needed.


---


Example Output


After running the plugin, if you've selected 3 components, pasting into a document will give something like this:


https://www.figma.com/file/{fileKey}/?node-id=123:456

https://www.figma.com/file/{fileKey}/?node-id=789:1011

https://www.figma.com/file/{fileKey}/?node-id=112:1314


Each URL points directly to the specific frame or component within the Figma file.


---


Limitations:


The plugin needs the Figma file URL to extract the fileKey, which is a unique identifier for your Figma file. The fileKey allows it to accurately generate direct links to the frames or components you select.


The URL is only used temporarily to retrieve this key, ensuring privacy and security. The plugin does not store any information. Keep in mind, only users with access to your files can view or use the generated links.


About fileKeys: A fileKey is part of the URL that uniquely identifies each Figma file. It's essential for referencing the correct file when generating links for components or frames. To understand more about how fileKeys work and where they are located in your Figma URL, you can visit Figma's documentation here.
plugins.tagline: Batch copy mutliple frame links at a time

104295.release_notes: Enhanced Layer Order Handling: The plugin now respects the full layer hierarchy, including nested layers. Links are copied in the same order as they appear in the Figma layers panel, ensuring both top-level and child layers are accurately represented.
104295.tagline: Batch copy mutliple frame links at a time

plugins.name: Figma to Imgur
plugins.description:
Figma to Imgur is a simple plugin that instantly converts any resource from Figma into an Imgur link. One click, and your design is ready to share, present, or save.


✨ Features:

  1. Export more different resource at a time — no extra steps
  2. Imgur links are generated instantly
  3. Great for quick sharing, feedback, or posting online


🔮 How to Start

  1. Select your resources — you can pick up to 10 objects at once
  2. Click "Export Selected" — let the plugin do its magic
  3. Done! Your Imgur links are ready to use
plugins.tagline: Export your design to Imgur

plugins.name: Mattarello - Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
🛠 Imagine your design process as a bustling marketplace, where ideas are traded, and creativity flows like the spices in a bazaar. In this vibrant scene, your designs are like unique ingredients, ready to be mixed into the grand recipe of your project. But transferring these ingredients from the market stall (Figma) to your cooking station (GitHub or other servers) can often feel like navigating through a crowded square, balancing pots and pans filled with precious spices.


🔌 Introducing Mattarello, the magic carpet that effortlessly carries your Figma variables across the digital divide in a swift, seamless flight. This Figma plugin is your culinary assistant, meticulously organizing your spices (design tokens) into neat jars (JSON format), ready to be shelved directly into your pantry (GitHub or other servers), automating your workflow as if by magic.


👨‍🍳 Embrace the future of design-cooking with our plugin, and let your creative dishes be seasoned to perfection with the efficiency and harmony of automated spice delivery. Your design kitchen will never be the same, as you find more time to taste, experiment, and refine your creations to Michelin-star standards.


—————


💬 If you notice anything that doesn't seem accurate or could be improved, please reach out to me — I'd be delighted to have a conversation about it.


—————


With love and coffee, kkratter ❤️
plugins.tagline: Export design tokens from Figma to Github

plugins.name: Variables → Text Styles
plugins.description:
Easily Apply Variables to Your Text Styles

Tired of manually assigning variables to text styles? Variables to Text Styles plugin lets you streamline this process by syncing your variables to existing text styles.


How It Works

You'll need existing text styles and typography variables ready to go, then follow these steps:


  1. Create text objects
  2. Apply variables to the text layers' properties
  3. Name the text layers to match their corresponding text style. If your styles are in folders, include the full path using '/' (e.g., folder/subfolder/style)
  4. Run the plugin
  5. Select your text layers. If you make changes, you'll need to reselect them.
  6. Click "Update Text Styles" to apply the variables


Important Notes

  1. If you modify your text properties while the plugin is open, reselect them to refresh the updates.
  2. This plugin does not convert text layers into styles, allowing you to continue making adjustments.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer • Plugin Author • Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Sync variables with your text styles.

Whether you're building an MVP, designing a concept, or need a design shortcut, Superfiles gives you access to a curated collection of mobile UI screens you can drag, drop, and edit in seconds.


🎯 What you get:


90+ FREE editable mobile UI screens

Premium UI collections for pro-level projects

Organized by category for fast selection

100% Figma-native and fully customizable


🚀 How to use Superfiles:


  1. Open the plugin in Figma
  2. Browse editable UI screens
  3. Click to insert
  4. Customize and create


No fluff. No friction. Just Super UI files, ready when you are. 🔥

plugins.name: Button States Generator
plugins.description:
Enhance your design workflow with the Button States Generator and create consistent, accessible button components effortlessly.


Overview


The Button States Generator is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the creation of button components with multiple states: Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Selected, and Disabled.


Features


- Dynamic Button Creation: Generate button components with customizable dimensions, radius, paddings & colors

- State Variants: Automatically create and manage button states including Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Selected, and Disabled.

- Color Customization: Easily adjust each state colors, with options to randomize or reset to default.

- Contrast Checker: Built-in contrast checker ensures your design meets WCAG standards for accessibility.

- Icon Placement Options: Choose from multiple icon placement options (none, left, right, or icon-only) as a component property.


How to Use


Assuming you already have your button design ready:


1. Select button Frame: Start by selecting the frame of your button.

2. Customize Settings (optional): Use the plugin's UI to adjust dimensions, colors, and other settings if necessary.

3. Choose Icon Placement (optional): Select the icon placement option from the dropdown menu (none, left, right, or icon-only).

4. Generate Components: Click 'Create Component' to generate the button variants.


Note: This will not work if you select a pre-existing component. If your button is a component, detach it to convert it into a Frame.


Component Properties


The generated button component includes these useful properties:


- States: Choose between Default, Hover, Focus, Selected, and Disabled states

- Icon: Control icon placement (None, Left, Right, Only)

- Colors: Adjust text and background colors for each state

- Dimensions: Fine-tune sizing, radius and padding


Support


For any questions or support, please contact luc.hespel@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Generate Button component with variants / states instantly

3. Choose Icon Placement (optional): Select the icon placement option from the dropdown menu (none, left, right, or icon-only).

4. Generate Components: Click 'Create Component' to generate the button variants.

Support


For any questions or support, please contact luc.hespel@gmail.com

134571.tagline: Generate Button component with variants / states instantly

plugins.name: RealSize Plugin
plugins.description:
RealScale is a Figma plugin that allows designers to view their designs at real-world size directly on the canvas. It automatically scales the viewport based on the PPI (pixels per inch) of your display, giving you an accurate representation of how your designs will appear on real devices. Simply install the plugin, select a layer and run the plugin.


How to use:

  1. Select a layer
  2. Activate the RealScale plugin.
  3. Enter the display details (resolution and screen size).
  4. Enter the target display details.
  5. Enjoy viewing your design in true-to-life dimensions!


Note: No subscription required.

accepted.name: Fail Fast
accepted.description: Digital experience design studio with +90 creatives. Embracing fearless innovation, we ideate, prototype, test, and learn without fear of failing.

plugins.tagline: Scale your designs to real size instantly.

127128.name: RealSize Plugin
127128.description:
RealScale is a Figma plugin that allows designers to view their designs at real-world size directly on the canvas. It automatically scales the viewport based on the PPI (pixels per inch) of your display, giving you an accurate representation of how your designs will appear on real devices. Simply install the plugin, select a layer and run the plugin.


How to use:

  1. Select a layer
  2. Activate the RealScale plugin.
  3. Enter the display details (resolution and screen size).
  4. Enter the target display details.
  5. Enjoy viewing your design in true-to-life dimensions!


Note: No subscription required.
127128.tagline: Scale your designs to real size instantly.

plugins.name: Copy JSON

plugins.name: Nong’s Handoff Tools
plugins.description:
Usage:

  1. Connect Pages: Select two Frames that need to be linked. In the plugin panel, choose the direction for the outgoing lines of the two Frames, then click the “Link” button to create the connection.
  2. Add Text Annotations: Select the element that needs an annotation. Click the button in the plugin panel to generate a number and text annotation.
  3. Draw Flowchart: Click the button to generate an element individually. Alternatively, select an existing element and then click the button to connect it to the selected element.
  4. Change Background Color: Click the “Page” button to change the color of the page. Select a Section and click the “Section” button to change the Section’s color. Click the “Area” button to directly generate a Frame for a separate Area.



使用方式：

  1. 连接页面：选择两个需要连线的Frame，在插件面板上选择两个Frame 出线的方向，点击Link按钮，即可连线。
  2. 添加文字备注：选择需要备注的元素，在插件面板上点击按钮，即可生成序号和文字。
  3. 绘制流程图：单独点击按钮可单独生成元素。也可先选择某个元素，再点击按钮，则会连接到选择的元素上。
  4. 背景色更改：直接点击Page按钮会更改Page的颜色。选择Section，点击Section按钮，则会修改Section颜色。点击Area按钮，会直接生成一个单独Area的Frame。
plugins.tagline: Connect & Description & Flow & Background

126702.name: Nong’s Handoff Tools
126702.description:
Usage:

  1. Connect Pages: Select two Frames that need to be linked. In the plugin panel, choose the direction for the outgoing lines of the two Frames, then click the “Link” button to create the connection.
  2. Add Text Annotations: Select the element that needs an annotation. Click the button in the plugin panel to generate a number and text annotation.
  3. Draw Flowchart: Click the button to generate an element individually. Alternatively, select an existing element and then click the button to connect it to the selected element.
  4. Change Background Color: Click the “Page” button to change the color of the page. Select a Section and click the “Section” button to change the Section’s color. Click the “Area” button to directly generate a Frame for a separate Area.



使用方式：

  1. 连接页面：选择两个需要连线的Frame，在插件面板上选择两个Frame 出线的方向，点击Link按钮，即可连线。
  2. 添加文字备注：选择需要备注的元素，在插件面板上点击按钮，即可生成序号和文字。

  4. 背景色更改：直接点击Page按钮会更改Page的颜色。选择Section，点击Section按钮，则会修改Section颜色。点击Area按钮，会直接生成一个单独Area的Frame。
126702.release_notes: 修复了双侧箭头的问题

plugins.name: FigWrite
plugins.description:
Effortlessly collaborate with UX and content writers!


Export your design text to an Excel file, let writers make updates, then seamlessly import and synchronize changes with your designs. Streamlining teamwork in a snap!


How it works

  • Select the frame you want to export
  • Organize your text by adding tags
  • Export as an Excel file
  • Update text or add translation in Excel
  • Import and synchronize with your frame in Figma


Leave us a comment or get in touch with us if you have any feedback or recommendations.
plugins.tagline: Update text in your designs with Excel

plugins.name: Frame Inspector
plugins.description:
Frame Inspector is a powerful Figma plugin designed to enhance your workflow by simplifying frame management. With Frame Inspector, you can effortlessly select multiple frames and instantly interpret their widths, while automatically adding device labels and pixel measurements to their names. Say goodbye to manual labeling and tedious calculations!


Simply select the desired frames, and Frame Inspector will analyze their widths and append the appropriate labels to their names, indicating whether they represent a mobile device, tablet, or desktop view.


Additionally, the plugin displays the precise width measurement in pixels, making it easier than ever to identify and organize frames according to their intended display context.

accepted.name: Jorge Steban Talaga Soto
accepted.description:
👋 Hello, I'm Jorge Steban!
I'm a UI designer with 3 years of expertise in creating intuitive and visually appealing user experiences.

plugins.tagline: Streamline frame organization in Figma with automatic device and width labeling.

60156.name: Frame Inspector
60156.description:
Frame Inspector is a powerful Figma plugin designed to enhance your workflow by simplifying frame management. With Frame Inspector, you can effortlessly select multiple frames and instantly interpret their widths, while automatically adding device labels and pixel measurements to their names. Say goodbye to manual labeling and tedious calculations!


Simply select the desired frames, and Frame Inspector will analyze their widths and append the appropriate labels to their names, indicating whether they represent a mobile device, tablet, or desktop view.


Additionally, the plugin displays the precise width measurement in pixels, making it easier than ever to identify and organize frames according to their intended display context.
60156.tagline: Streamline frame organization in Figma with automatic device and width labeling.

plugins.name: Knak - Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
Turn Figma Designs into Production-Ready HTML—In Seconds


The Knak - Figma Plugin helps Marketing Designers bring their Figma designs into Knak and turn them into fully editable emails—without having to start from scratch. Instead of manually rebuilding designs, you can import them directly into Knak, refine the details, and create reusable modules and themes that fit into your workflows.


With this plugin, you can:

✅ Speed up Design-to-Production Workflow

✅ Transform Figma designs into Knak HTML in seconds—no manual handoffs, no back-and-forth.

✅ Keep Designers in Figma

✅ Let designers stay in the tool they love while keeping every email on-brand. Push designs to Knak with one click, ensuring a smooth handoff that preserves brand guidelines and creative integrity.

✅ Make it easier for Marketing Operations to review and finalize designs.


How it works


1 - Design in Figma

  1. Create email layouts using the Knak - Figma Plugin.

2 - Sync to Knak

  1. Push designs directly into Knak’s no-code builder with a single click.

3 - Refine & Launch

  1. Fine-tune, personalize, and translate in Knak, then send directly to your marketing automation platform.


Read the step-by-step guide here.


Need help? Visit our help centre.

accepted.name: Knak
accepted.description: Knak is a no-code campaign creation platform, enabling users to design, collaborate, and deploy emails & landing pages with ease.

plugins.tagline: Move your Figma designs into Knak and get emails across the finish line, fast.

plugins.name: CSS Color Extrator
plugins.description:
CSS Color Extractor

CSS Color Extractor es una herramienta intuitiva que te permite extraer todos los colores CSS utilizados en cualquier sitio web con solo ingresar la URL. Simplifica el proceso de recoger y reutilizar colores de otros sitios para tus proyectos, ya sea que necesites inspiración de una paleta ya existente o simplemente quieras analizar los tonos usados en una página.


Características Principales:

  1. Extracción Rápida desde una URL: Introduce la URL de cualquier sitio web y extrae todos los colores CSS utilizados, incluyendo variables declaradas en en el root.
  2. Copiado Manual: También puedes pegar manualmente las declaraciones CSS del inspector de tu navegador para obtener los colores.
  3. Identificación y Copiado Fácil: Copia los valores hexadecimales o las variables CSS con un solo clic.
  4. Interfaz Amigable: Diseñada con una interfaz limpia y amigable que hace que la experiencia sea intuitiva y eficiente.
  5. Ideal para Diseñadores y Desarrolladores: Si buscas una forma rápida de identificar paletas de colores en la web, CSS Color Extractor es perfecto para ayudarte a ahorrar tiempo.


¿Cómo usarlo?

  1. Ingresa la URL de la página web de la cual deseas extraer los colores, o copia y pega las declaraciones CSS.
  2. Presiona el botón "EXTRAER COLORES" y obtén todos los colores utilizados.
  3. Selecciona cualquier color para ver su código hex o nombre de variable CSS, y cópialo fácilmente al portapapeles.
plugins.tagline: Extrae la paleta de colores de un sitio web

106052.name: CSS Color Extrator
106052.description:

Características Principales:

  2. Copiado Manual: También puedes pegar manualmente las declaraciones CSS del inspector de tu navegador para obtener los colores.
  3. Identificación y Copiado Fácil: Copia los valores hexadecimales o las variables CSS con un solo clic.
  4. Interfaz Amigable: Diseñada con una interfaz limpia y amigable que hace que la experiencia sea intuitiva y eficiente.
  5. Ideal para Diseñadores y Desarrolladores: Si buscas una forma rápida de identificar paletas de colores en la web, CSS Color Extractor es perfecto para ayudarte a ahorrar tiempo.

plugins.name: Mock Data Generator
plugins.description:
Mock Data Generator is a Figma plugin designed to enhance the design process within Figma by allowing designers to insert realistic mock text data directly into their designs. 


This plugin provides a wide range of data categories and types that can enable you to visualize how your design elements will appear when populated with actual data. 


By using this plugin, you can create more accurate, context-relevant prototypes, to improve the overall user experience and the efficiency of your design iterations.


How to Use the Plugin


  1. Open the Plugin: Start by selecting the text layer in your Figma design that you want to replace with mock data. Then, open the Mock Data Generator plugin from the Figma plugin menu.


  1. Select Category and Data Type: Use the dropdown menus to choose the category of data (e.g., Personal Identification, Professional Information) and then select the specific type of data you need (e.g., First Name, Email Address).


  1. Insert Data: Click the "Replace Selected Text" button to insert the selected mock data into the chosen text layer. If successful, the plugin will notify you that the text has been replaced. If not, it will provide a message prompting you to make the necessary selections.


  1. Review and Iterate: Review the design with the inserted data to ensure it meets your needs. Adjust categories and data types as necessary to simulate different user scenarios and refine your design.
plugins.tagline: Generate high-quality mock text data for your Figma designs.

100786.name: Mock Data Generator
100786.description:
Mock Data Generator is a Figma plugin designed to enhance the design process within Figma by allowing designers to insert realistic mock text data directly into their designs. 


This plugin provides a wide range of data categories and types that can enable you to visualize how your design elements will appear when populated with actual data. 


By using this plugin, you can create more accurate, context-relevant prototypes, to improve the overall user experience and the efficiency of your design iterations.


How to Use the Plugin


  1. Open the Plugin: Start by selecting the text layer in your Figma design that you want to replace with mock data. Then, open the Mock Data Generator plugin from the Figma plugin menu.


  1. Select Category and Data Type: Use the dropdown menus to choose the category of data (e.g., Personal Identification, Professional Information) and then select the specific type of data you need (e.g., First Name, Email Address).


  1. Insert Data: Click the "Replace Selected Text" button to insert the selected mock data into the chosen text layer. If successful, the plugin will notify you that the text has been replaced. If not, it will provide a message prompting you to make the necessary selections.


  1. Review and Iterate: Review the design with the inserted data to ensure it meets your needs. Adjust categories and data types as necessary to simulate different user scenarios and refine your design.
100786.tagline: Generate high-quality mock text data for your Figma designs.

plugins.name: AutoSpec
plugins.description:
Quickly apply focus areas in your layout, identifying roles/semantics, following WCAG rules.


In this version you can:

  • Work with multiple screens simultaneously
  • Add focus areas
  • Switch between two supported languages ​​(Portuguese and English)
  • Edit roles/semantics via JSON code


[🇧🇷] Colaboração

Este projeto de acessibilidade aplicada ao design teve a colaboração de demais pessoas, especialistas em acessibilidade e designers, na revisão das semânticas e estrutura das especificações e áreas de foco:

  • Nicola Vieira - Especialista em acessibilidade
  • Jonas de Oliveira Fernandes - Especialista em acessibilidade
  • Glauco Cardoso - UX Designer


Agradeço a todos pela contribuição impar ❤️
plugins.tagline: Build accessibility specs faster

plugins.name: Smart Reparent
plugins.description:
Use this plugin to insert nodes into an auto-layout frame as absolute-positioned children while preserving their existing position on canvas.


To use:

  1. Select the base frame and the nodes you wish to insert. Make sure the base frame is ordered behind the frames you wish to insert.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. Profit!
plugins.tagline: Reparent nodes into auto-layout frames while preserving position.

  2. Run the plugin.

plugins.name: Figscreen - Screenshot Websites
plugins.description:
Figscreen – Website Screenshots in Figma


Figscreen is a Figma plugin that lets you import website screenshots directly into your canvas. It’s a tool built to simplify the process of collecting and organizing web references.


Features

  1. Bulk Import: Capture up to 25 websites at once
  2. High-Quality Screenshots: Supports Retina resolution
  3. Custom Sizes: Choose from preset device sizes or set custom dimensions (320px to 1920px)
  4. Auto Layout: Screenshots are arranged and labelled on the canvas
  5. Full-Page Support: Captures entire web pages, including lazy-loaded sections
  6. Responsive Views: Capture desktop, tablet, and mobile layouts


How to Use

  1. Paste one or more URLs (must include “https://”)
  2. Choose device types or set custom dimensions
  3. Click “Import Screenshots”
  4. Screenshots will appear on your canvas, organized and ready to use


Notes

  1. Works with public websites (no login required)
  2. Captures full pages, including dynamic content
  3. Upcoming features: option to hide banners, pop-ups, and chat widgets


If you have any questions, contact: support@figscreen.com

Found a bug? Report it here: figscreen.com/feedback
plugins.tagline: Capture, Import, Display – Up to 25 Sites at Once

plugins.name: CopySlide
plugins.description: Transforme seu texto em carrosséis profissionais no Figma. O plugin detecta automaticamente padrões de conteúdo (ex: "Slide 1:", "Card 1:", listas), aplica 3 templates personalizáveis (Texto Simples, Educativo, Instagram Nativo) com cores e fontes customizáveis, e gera carrossel completo e diagramado

plugins.name: Fluid Gradient
plugins.description:
Create ambient gradients with full control, right inside your Figma frames.


Start by selecting a frame. Pick a background color, add soft blur shapes with custom size, position, and color—or hit “Random Gradient” for instant magic. Every shape stays fully editable in your layers, so you can tweak anything anytime.


Perfect for soft UI, dreamy layouts, and colorful moodboards.

accepted.name: prosha amiri
accepted.description: I'm the kind of designer who builds like an engineer, thinks like a strategist, and sketches like an artist.

plugins.tagline: Create ambient gradients with total creative control.

128099.name: Fluid Gradient
128099.description:

Start by selecting a frame. Pick a background color, add soft blur shapes with custom size, position, and color—or hit “Random Gradient” for instant magic. Every shape stays fully editable in your layers, so you can tweak anything anytime.


Perfect for soft UI, dreamy layouts, and colorful moodboards.

plugins.name: Convert to ICO
plugins.description:
Convert to Ico is a simple yet powerful Figma plugin that helps designers and developers easily transform any Figma element into Windows ICO icon files.


Key Features:

• Convert any Frame, Group, or Image to ICO format

• Multiple preset size options (16px, 32px, 48px, 64px, 128px)

• Real-time preview functionality

• Clean and intuitive interface

• Quick one-click export


Whether you're designing Windows application icons, website favicons, or working on any project that requires ICO format, Convert to Ico streamlines your workflow with its efficient conversion process.
plugins.tagline: Convert any Figma design to ICO icons in one click

125328.name: Convert to ICO
125328.description:

Whether you're designing Windows application icons, website favicons, or working on any project that requires ICO format, Convert to Ico streamlines your workflow with its efficient conversion process.
125328.tagline: Convert any Figma design to ICO icons in one click

plugins.name: GoodWay Sprite
plugins.description: Figma Sprite Generator plugin makes it simple to turn your selected icons into efficient sprite sheets along with the corresponding JSON metadata. Perfect for developers and designers alike, this plugin helps streamline the process of preparing icons for web projects or UI libraries by creating a PNG sprite file and a JSON file containing icon coordinates and sizes.
plugins.tagline: Easily generate sprite sheets and JSON metadata from icons selected in Figma.

105019.name: GoodWay Sprite
105019.description: Figma Sprite Generator plugin makes it simple to turn your selected icons into efficient sprite sheets along with the corresponding JSON metadata. Perfect for developers and designers alike, this plugin helps streamline the process of preparing icons for web projects or UI libraries by creating a PNG sprite file and a JSON file containing icon coordinates and sizes.
105019.release_notes: ✨ Add ratio select to generate the sprite based on the selected ratio.
105019.tagline: Easily generate sprite sheets and JSON metadata from icons selected in Figma.

plugins.name: pixelbrush
plugins.description:
Pixelbrush allows you to quickly draw, pixel by pixel. Because every pixel drawn is a square, these drawings can easily be resized, copied, and manipulated with Figma's default selection tools.


Basic undo is supported. This plugin provides an earthy palette of 6 colors by default, but users can now use their own custom palette's by creating and selecting a set of squares with colors of their choice and then pressing the "select button" in the pixelbrush interface!


Tips:

  1. If you are having trouble finding the square or the plugin behavior is unresponsive try pressing "reset"
  2. If this fails, try exiting out of the plugin and restarting it with option + command + p.
  3. rasterize large pixel art to make copying it more performant.
  4. Option + drag is a great way to create patterns.
plugins.tagline: Create and manipulate pixel art

112648.name: pixelbrush
112648.description:
Pixelbrush allows you to quickly draw, pixel by pixel. Because every pixel drawn is a square, these drawings can easily be resized, copied, and manipulated with Figma's default selection tools.


Basic undo is supported. This plugin provides an earthy palette of 6 colors by default, but users can now use their own custom palette's by creating and selecting a set of squares with colors of their choice and then pressing the "select button" in the pixelbrush interface!


Tips:

  1. If you are having trouble finding the square or the plugin behavior is unresponsive try pressing "reset"
  2. If this fails, try exiting out of the plugin and restarting it with option + command + p.
  3. rasterize large pixel art to make copying it more performant.
  4. Option + drag is a great way to create patterns.
112648.release_notes: - Added color selection button and functionality

plugins.name: Onyx ◆ Design System to Code
plugins.description:
Onyx ◆ Design System to Code


◆ Overview


Onyx is designed to simplify the workflow between design and development by automating the conversion of your Figma Design System into ready-to-use Vue components. Its ability to handle multiple selected component variants and integrate design tokens provided via the Tokens Studio for Figma plugin makes it a powerful tool for modern web development.


Onyx is a Figma plugin designed to efficiently translate Figma Design Systems into Vue components, utilizing UnoCSS utility classes. This tool targets developers and designers looking to streamline the conversion of their design systems into functional, reactive UI components directly usable in Vue projects.


Project is open source:

https://github.com/onyx-gen/onyx



◆ What It Does


  • Figma Components to Vue Components: Onyx allows users to select components within Figma and generate corresponding Vue components. Design properties are translated to UnoCSS utility classes.


  • Support for Design Tokens: The plugin integrates with Tokens Studio, another Figma plugin, to convert design tokens into CSS variables. These variables are then passed to the UnoCSS utility classes (e.g., background color design token named primary.bg.hover generates the bg-$primary.bg.hover UnoCSS utility class)


  • Multi-Variant Component Support: Users can select multiple variants of a component (such as default, hover, and focused) and Onyx will generate a single Vue component. Onyx automatically applies the correct UnoCSS variants (e.g., bg-red-600 hover:bg-red-700 focus:bg-red-800)


  • Live Preview: Onyx provides a real-time preview of the generated Vue components within Figma via an iframe. This feature ensures that components are visually and functionally in sync with the Figma design.



◆ How to Use It


  1. Select Components: Start by selecting one or multiple components within your Figma design system.
  2. Open the Onyx Figma plugin: Open the Onyx Figma plugin in Figma's plugin panel.
  3. Generate Code: Onyx automatically generates Vue components for the selected Figma components.
  4. Implement in Project: Copy the generated Vue component into your Vue project.



◆ Limitations


  • Work in Progress: As the plugin is still under development, some design properties may not convert perfectly into UnoCSS utility classes. At the moment not all design tokens types can be applied.


  • Design Compatibility: There may be limitations in how certain Figma design properties translate to UnoCSS utility classes, potentially requiring manual adjustments.
plugins.tagline: Components & Design Tokens → Vue & UnoCSS
